description: Numbers that are the sum of at most 3 positive cubes.
comments: Or: numbers which are the sum of 3 (not necessarily distinct) nonnegative cubes. - _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 09 2015
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for sequences related to sums of cubes
maple: isA004825 := proc(n)    local x,y,zc ;    for x from 0 do        if 3*x^3 > n then            return false;        end if;        for y from x do            if x^3+2*y^3 > n then                break;            else                zc := n-x^3-y^3 ;                if zc >= y^3 and isA000578(zc) then                    return true;                end if;            end if;        end do:    end do:end proc:A004825 := proc(n)    option remember;    local a;    if n = 1 then        0;    else        for a from procname(n-1)+1 do            if isA004825(a) then                return a;            end if;        end do:    end if;end proc:seq(A004825(n),n=1..100) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 09 2015
mathematica: q=7; imax=q^3; Select[Union[Flatten[Table[x^3+y^3+z^3, {x,0,q}, {y,x,q}, {z,y,q}]]], #<=imax&] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Apr 20 2011 *)
prog: (PARI) list(lim)=my(v=List(),k,t); for(x=0,sqrtnint(lim\=1,3), for(y=0, min(sqrtnint(lim-x^3,3),x), k=x^3+y^3; for(z=0,min(sqrtnint(lim-k,3), y), listput(v, k+z^3)))); Set(v) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 14 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
